# bin2asm

Generates .db or .byte listings from a binary file, in binary or hexadecimal.

## Example, binary output, using .db

```
$ bin2asm.exe in=example.atr out=example2.s label=pie usedb bin bytesperline=8
```

Outputs: 

```s
; Generated by bin2asm.exe in=example.atr out=example2.s label=pie usedb bin bytesperline=8

pie:
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %10101000, %10100010, %11001100, %11111111, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %10001010, %00100010, %11001100, %11111111, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
    .db %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000, %00000000
```

## Example, hexadecimal output, using .byte

```
bin2asm.exe in=example.atr out=example.s label=pie
```

Outputs:

```s
; Generated by bin2asm.exe in=example.atr out=example.s label=pie

pie:
    .byte $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00
    .byte $00, $00, $A8, $A2, $CC, $FF, $00, $00, $00, $00, $8A, $22, $CC, $FF, $00, $00
    .byte $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00
    .byte $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00, $00

```
